description.narrative:
The contribution aims to provide core support to TIACs ongoing efforts in promoting good governance and anti-corruption policies as well as securing the organizational development through the following objectives;
Objective 1: Policy and legislative change to ensure transparent and accountable governance
Objective 2: Behavioral change to enhance intolerance of citizens toward corruption
Objective 3: Outreach and awareness raising to influence the policy and behavior changes
Objective 4: Organizational development of TIAC

Transparency International Anti-Corruption Center - Armenia (TIAC) har ansökt till Sida om finansiering på totalt 7 100 000 SEK för att genomföra projektet "Institutional Support Grant" under perioden 2021-2023.
Insatsen syftar till att genom kärnstöd till TIAC stödja pågående ansträngningar för att främja god samhällsstyrning och antikorruptionspolicy genom följande mål; 1) policy och lagändring för att säkerställa transparent och ansvarsfull styrning, 2) beteendeförändring för att öka medborgarnas intolerans mot korruption; 3) uppsökande och medvetandehöjande för att påverka policyn och beteendeförändringar; 4) organisationsutveckling.
Stödet, som planeras att tillhandahållas i form av kärnstöd kommer att syfta till att möjliggöra för TIAC att bidra till Armeniens demokratiska utveckling. Insatsen kommer enbart att genomföras av TIAC, utan vidareförmedling av medel till tredje part.

Transparency International Anti-corruption Center - Armenia (TIAC) has applied to Sida for funding of 7 100 000 SEK, to carry out "Institutional Support Grant" project during the period of 2021-2023.
The intervention aims to provide core support to TIAC’s ongoing efforts in promoting good governance and anti-corruption policies through the following objectives; 1) policy and legislative change to ensure transparent and accountable governance; 2) behavioral change to enhance intolerance of citizens toward corruption; 3) outreach and awareness raising to influence the policy and behavior changes; 4) organizational development.
The support, which is planned to be provided in the form of core support, will enable TIAC to contribute to Armenia´s democratic development. The intervention will be solely implemented by TIAC, with no forwarding of funds to third parties.

tag.narrative: 16.5 - Substantially reduce corruption and bribery in all their forms.
16.5 - Väsentligt minska alla former av korruption och mutor.
16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.

description.narrative:
In accordance with its mission and goals and though implementation of the activities, TIAC aims to contribute to the reduction of corruption and strengthening democracy in Armenia. The expected indicators for a progress would be; • the improvement of public perception on the effectiveness of the national anticorruption strategy and on the level of corruption; • the increase of the score of CPI above 50; • the improvement of the democracy performance in accordance with the World Freedom Index; • improvement of the World Bank Governance Indicators particularly the Control of Corruption and the Rule of Law.
Expected results Objective 1 1.1 Improved anticorruption policy implementation and compliance to international commitments 1.2 Adoption of better laws and amendments 1.3 Advanced dialogue for promoting policy changes
Objective 2 2.1 Advanced knowledge and improved skills to fight corruption 2.2 Enhanced whistleblowing practices
Objective 3 3.1 Increased number of awareness raising products 3.2 Advanced knowledge and engagement in corruption-related matters
Objective 4 4.1 Enhanced networking and peer learning 4.2 Improved performance 4.3 Expanded activities
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
